messages.content: What is ImageTextOverlay in the context of ComfyUI?
ImageTextOverlay is a customizable Node for ComfyUI that allows users to easily add text overlays to images within their ComfyUI projects.
Which libraries does ImageTextOverlay Node use to dynamically render text on images?
ImageTextOverlay Node uses Python Imaging Library (PIL) and PyTorch to dynamically render text on images.
What are some customization options available with ImageTextOverlay Node?
Customization options include font size, alignment, color, and padding.
How do I install the ImageTextOverlay Node into ComfyUI?
To install ImageTextOverlay Node, use git clone https://github.com/Big-Idea-Technology/ImageTextOverlay to custom_nodes in ComfyUI folder.
What are the parameters that need to be configured within the ImageTextOverlay Node?
Parameters include image, text, textbox_width & textbox_height, max_font_size, font, alignment, color, start_x & start_y, and padding.
Is there any license associated with the ImageTextOverlay Node?
Yes, the ImageTextOverlay Node is licensed under MIT License.
Who are contributors encouraged to follow for contributing to the ImageTextOverlay Node project?
Contributors should follow the project's contribution guidelines for submitting issues or pull requests.
